parts.text: {"word":"establecer","priority":"★★★","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitive","definition":"Fundar, instituir, crear algo, especialmente una organización, una ley o una costumbre.","english_definition":"To found, institute, or create something, especially an organization, a law, or a custom.","examples":[{"sentence":"Establecieron una nueva empresa de tecnología.","translation":"They established a new technology company.","english_translation":"They established a new technology company."},{"sentence":"El gobierno estableció nuevas leyes para proteger el medio ambiente.","translation":"The government established new laws to protect the environment.","english_translation":"The government established new laws to protect the environment."},{"sentence":"Establecieron la costumbre de reunirse todos los domingos.","translation":"They established the custom of meeting every Sunday.","english_translation":"They established the custom of meeting every Sunday."}],"collocations":["establecer una empresa","establecer una ley","establecer una costumbre","establecer un récord"],"synonyms":["fundar","instituir","crear","organizar","inaugurar"],"antonyms":["abolir","derogar","destruir"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitive","definition":"Determinar, fijar o precisar algo, como un precio, una fecha o una condición.","english_definition":"To determine, fix, or specify something, such as a price, a date, or a condition.","examples":[{"sentence":"Establecieron el precio de venta en 100 dólares.","translation":"They set the selling price at 100 dollars.","english_translation":"They set the selling price at 100 dollars."},{"sentence":"Establecieron la fecha de la reunión para el próximo martes.","translation":"They set the date of the meeting for next Tuesday.","english_translation":"They set the date of the meeting for next Tuesday."},{"sentence":"Establecieron las condiciones del contrato.","translation":"They established the conditions of the contract.","english_translation":"They established the conditions of the contract."}],"collocations":["establecer un precio","establecer una fecha","establecer una condición","establecer un límite"],"synonyms":["determinar","fijar","precisar","definir","estipular"],"antonyms":["variar","modificar","cambiar"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitive","definition":"Asegurar, confirmar o demostrar algo con pruebas o argumentos.","english_definition":"To ensure, confirm, or demonstrate something with evidence or arguments.","examples":[{"sentence":"Establecieron su inocencia con pruebas irrefutables.","translation":"They established their innocence with irrefutable evidence.","english_translation":"They established their innocence with irrefutable evidence."},{"sentence":"El estudio estableció una relación entre el tabaco y el cáncer.","translation":"The study established a relationship between tobacco and cancer.","english_translation":"The study established a relationship between tobacco and cancer."},{"sentence":"Establecieron la validez de su teoría con experimentos.","translation":"They established the validity of their theory with experiments.","english_translation":"They established the validity of their theory with experiments."}],"collocations":["establecer la inocencia","establecer una relación","establecer la validez","establecer un hecho"],"synonyms":["asegurar","confirmar","demostrar","probar","verificar"],"antonyms":["negar","refutar","desmentir"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","pronominal","definition":"Instalarse o radicarse en un lugar para vivir o trabajar.","english_definition":"To settle or take root in a place to live or work.","examples":[{"sentence":"Se establecieron en la ciudad después de la guerra.","translation":"They settled in the city after the war.","english_translation":"They settled in the city after the war."},{"sentence":"Muchos inmigrantes se establecieron en este barrio.","translation":"Many immigrants settled in this neighborhood.","english_translation":"Many immigrants settled in this neighborhood."},{"sentence":"Piensan establecerse en el campo para tener una vida más tranquila.","translation":"They plan to settle in the countryside to have a more peaceful life.","english_translation":"They plan to settle in the countryside to have a more peaceful life."}],"collocations":["establecerse en un lugar","establecerse como profesional","establecerse por su cuenta"],"synonyms":["instalarse","radicarse","afincarse","residir","asentarse"],"antonyms":["emigrar","mudarse","trasladarse"]}],"etymology":{"value":"Del latín *stabiliscere*, derivado de *stabilis* (estable).","priority":"★★☆"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/estableˈθeɾ/ (España), /estableˈseɾ/ (América Latina)","syllables":"es-ta-ble-cer"},"inflection":{"verb_forms":{"presente":["establezco","estableces","establece","establecemos","establecéis","establecen"],"pretérito_perfecto_simple":["establecí","estableciste","estableció","establecimos","establecisteis","establecieron"],"futuro_simple":["estableceré","establecerás","establecerá","estableceremos","estableceréis","establecerán"],"condicional_simple":["establecería","establecerías","establecería","estableceríamos","estableceríais","establecerían"],"subjuntivo_presente":["establezca","establezcas","establezca","establezcamos","establezcáis","establezcan"],"subjuntivo_pretérito_imperfecto":["estableciera / estableciese","establecieras / establecieses","estableciera / estableciese","estableciéramos / estableciésemos","establecierais / establecieseis","establecieran / estableciesen"],"imperativo":["establece (tú) / estableced (vosotros)","establezca (usted) / establezcan (ustedes)"]}},"usage_notes":{"explanation":"*Establecer* es un verbo versátil con varios significados importantes. Es crucial entender el contexto para determinar el significado preciso. Puede referirse a la creación de algo nuevo, la fijación de algo existente, la confirmación de un hecho, o el acto de establecerse uno mismo en un lugar. La forma pronominal (*establecerse*) se refiere específicamente a la acción de instalarse en un lugar.","priority":"★★★"},"common_mistakes":{"examples":[{"incorrect":"Establecer la casa en Madrid.","correct":"Establecerse en Madrid.","note":"Para referirse a instalarse en un lugar, se usa la forma pronominal *establecerse*."},{"incorrect":"Establecer un precio barato.","correct":"Fijar un precio barato.","note":"Aunque *establecer* puede significar fijar, en el contexto de precios, *fijar* es más común."}],"priority":"★★☆"},"related_words":{"derivatives":["establecimiento (establecimiento)","estable (estable)","estabilidad (estabilidad)","establecido (establecido)"],"phrases":["establecer contacto (establecer contacto)","establecer relaciones (establecer relaciones)","establecer un diálogo (establecer un diálogo)"],"priority":"★★★"},"level_frequency":{"CEFR":"B1","frequency_corpus":"Común","priority":"★☆☆"},"readability_explanation":{"level":"B1","text":"El verbo *establecer* significa principalmente crear algo nuevo (como una empresa o una ley), fijar algo (como un precio o una fecha), o demostrar algo con pruebas. También puede significar instalarse en un lugar. Es importante prestar atención al contexto para entender qué significado se está utilizando.","priority":"★★☆"},"example_sentences":[{"sentence":"El gobierno quiere **establecer** una nueva política económica.","translation":"The government wants to establish a new economic policy.","type":"transitive","meaning_category":"Crear"},{"sentence":"¿Podemos **establecer** una fecha para la próxima reunión?","translation":"Can we set a date for the next meeting?","type":"transitive","meaning_category":"Fijar"},{"sentence":"La investigación **estableció** que el producto es seguro.","translation":"The research established that the product is safe.","type":"transitive","meaning_category":"Demostrar"},{"sentence":"Después de jubilarse, se **establecieron** en un pueblo pequeño.","translation":"After retiring, they settled in a small town.","type":"pronominal","meaning_category":"Instalarse"}]}
